item.title: Not emptied public waste bin, 30th October
item.description:
Hi This public waste bin has not been emptied for around a week. ( As if Thu 30/10 10am) As you can see it's overflowing and looking very messy Can someone sort this out please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scholars Court, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 inch pot holes, 30th October
item.description:
The road was damaged by recent rain, Highways came out, mended two of the large pot holes but left this one which is increasing in size as its constantly being driven over. Why was this not fixed whilst the team was on site in the last week or so? Needs a revisit to the site to be repaired, how can this be cost effective and value for money for tax payers?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water on cycle path, 30th October
item.description:
Standing water on cycle path south of Walnut Close remains for several days following any rain. Similar problem north of Walnut Close, although not as problematic. This has been happening regularly for several months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Collapsed utility cover next to telegraph pole. Hole is about 30cm + deep. Unlit road. Hole on narrow pavement so pedestrians have to walk in the road to avoid hole. Currently has 2 traffic cones covering hole to alert people. Very dangerous as no street lights and narrow road.., 30th October
item.description:
Opposite The Gables house Shipton Oliffe

item.title: Constant littering on grass verges and gutter area, 29th October
item.description:
Always littering here along gutter and verge as one of the main routes on and off the estate including beer cans, lunch litter, fag butts etc, could we get some council anti-litter signage up on bridge near entrance to estate
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Raised cracked uneven path, 29th October
item.description:
